body_html:
Looks great! I was looking forward to something like this.
I'm wondering if we can simplify https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7121/files#diff-7c10ee18ff3c7ed0cfa68df0e062e9b0R122
by using file(GLOB on tools/autograd/templates and tools/jit/templates. Although these directories don't change often, so being explicit might be good too.
body_text:
Looks great! I was looking forward to something like this.
I'm wondering if we can simplify https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7121/files#diff-7c10ee18ff3c7ed0cfa68df0e062e9b0R122
by using file(GLOB on tools/autograd/templates and tools/jit/templates. Although these directories don't change often, so being explicit might be good too.
body:
Looks great! I was looking forward to something like this.
I'm wondering if we can simplify https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7121/files#diff-7c10ee18ff3c7ed0cfa68df0e062e9b0R122
by using `file(GLOB` on `tools/autograd/templates` and `tools/jit/templates`. Although these directories don't change often, so being explicit might be good too.
